medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented with a 5-month history of asymptomatic white spots on her hair.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 5 months prior to presentation and consisted of discrete, white, adherent nodules scattered throughout her hair. There was no associated scalp erythema or alopecia.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's younger sister also presented with similar white spots in her hair and was diagnosed with a fungal infection.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had a partner from Mexico and had not recently traveled outside the United States.
